column7: <input type=""hidden"" name=""PageName"" value=""Card on Expense Pre-Approvals"">

column2: <a href=""/en-us"" title=""What can we help you find?"">

column3: What can we help you find?

column1: Coupa Pay helps you leverage your company's existing credit line accounts and manages the provisioning of virtual credit cards for pre approved expenses.

Pre Approved virtual cards make paying for business expenses easy. Expense users can now get virtual cards to pay for pre approved expenses when the customer has both Expenses and Coupa Pay (Virtual Cards) in scope

Getting pre-approval makes spending easier and more manageable. Virtual cards reward the behavior of seeking approval before spend, and specifically limited card amounts with a valid period that can be limited also help enforce accountability.

Customers should have a Virtual card banking partner identified and should have completed their agreements and all the prerequisites to be able to implement Virtual cards (Check with Coupa Banking Operations team on the status/update)
Customers should have implemented/implementing Expense Payments

As part of the Coupa Pay Provisioning request you must include an option to enable pre approved expenses and pre approved form with virtual cards as part of your request (Please look at the tickets here on success).
Once provisioned, your ticket for creation of payment partner request must include an option to check “Expense Pre approvals”

Once expense users submit their request for a Virtual credit card by using an expense pre approval form, the expense pre approvals have to approve it from either their To Do’s or they can go into Setup – Expense Preapproval Form responses to approve the pre approved forms that will further issue Virtual cards to the Expense users.

Once expense users swipe the card and the charges come into Coupa, Expense reports are created automatically and the charges on that virtual card are gathered as expense lines. They are also recorded for credit line account reconciliation.

Expense users can submit a request for virtual card and get a pre approved Virtual credit card issued, only, if the payment partner is mapped to a default Chart of Account. This accounting string could later be changed/adjusted after the Cards are used and Charges come into Coupa that creates an expense Line and before the Expense Reports are submitted for approval.

1. Once User/Employee uses the Virtual card and the Charges come into Coupa, the charges will have a holding account string associated that is defined at the Payment Partner level. It is recommended that the charges integrate into ERP and Dr. The Expense account and Cr. CC Payables. This will allow the customer to accrue their charges and record a liability against their Virtual card Banking partner before even the user submits the ER for approval.

2. Once the Expense Report is submitted and approved, Integrate the Expense Report into ERP. At this time if the Expense Lines were updated/modified with the new billing string that is different from the Charge Holding account, then at the time of Integrating the ER’s into ERP, the earlier holding account will be reversed to reflect the new billing string in ERP.

3. It is highly recommended that customer pushes their users/employees to submit their Expense Reports for approval once the users see the charges for their requested cards come into Coupa. This will allow for the Charges to accrue with the right billing strings for that month whether it be the Holding account or the Updated Expense Line billing accounts that was performed before the ER was approved and integrated into ERP.
• Customers can enforce that receipts be added in certain scenarios (higher than $xx, or for certain categories)
• Spend is categorized as with any other expense report
• There is an approval process for this spend so expense admins and managers see how the card is used

• Each expense line can hit a different billing string (something that can now be manually done with requester card charges, but is easier with expenses since the category can automatically drive this)

• Expense users no longer need to create a requisition with fields that don't really apply to a card request (e.g. supplier, service start dates, etc). As a user, all you really want to ask for is ""give me a card with X dollars"" which is supported in this model but not with requisitions
• Coupa Admins don't need to maintain different requisition forms to create a requester card with the ""Coupa pay supplier""
• Seamless UX with expenses which shows charges coming in as draft expense lines (where the amount and merchant is locked)
• Overall better reconciliation and less manual processing for card admins
These Virtual cards will be always generated in the currency of the Credit line established by the customer with their respective bank

These cards could be requested and used to pay foreign supplies. For example, if the Credit line is in USD and the cards are to be used to pay suppliers in GBP, this is still supported. The PO should be generated in GBP and Virtual cards will be issued in the Credit line currency (USD) for the corresponding value of the PO to cover the exchange rates.
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">Expense Pre Approval form approval chain</th>
Setup Expense Pre approval form approval chain to set up approvers to trigger once users submit an Expense pre approval form requesting for a pre approved Virtual card.
Submission blockers could also be set up within the Expense preapproval form approval chain to limit certain users from requesting pre approval Virtual cards for certain thresholds.
Expense pre approval form approval chains allow for conditional rules to block the submission or to route the proposed expense to the appropriate reviewers.
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">Expense Pre approval Form</th>

Customers must have a Preapproval Form so that the expense user can ask for the virtual card and submit details with any supporting documents about what and why they are proposing to spend. This will provide the Expense pre approvers with enough information to approve Virtual credit cards for expense users.
Failure to customize the Expense pre approval form will not allow Expense users to request pre-approved Virtual credit card

Coupa Expenses jump starts your Expense Pre Approval process with a simple customizable form. Your form helps expense users propose an expense for approvals. When and if they get pre approval, they can get a virtual card to pay for big ticket items like flight reservations and accommodations.
Have Coupa Support to Enable “Expense Pre Approvals” on Payment Partner as part of Payment Partner creation request
Checking the box on “Use Expense For” under Payment Partner allows the customer to define
specific validity period and tolerance on the Expense pre approved Virtual cards generated.
Defining the mapping of charges to a holding account and categorize charges by Merchant Category Code to automate charge handling.
Users will not be able to request Expense pre approved Virtual cards

Expense users can submit a request for virtual card and get a pre approved Virtual credit card issued, only if the payment partner is mapped to a default Chart of Account. This accounting string could later be changed/adjusted after the Cards are used and Charges come into Coupa creating an expense Line and before the Expense Reports are submitted for approval.
Customer doesn't have Virtual cards in scope to allow expense users to request for an expense pre approval Virtual card .
No Risks are incorporated into the current design and the design is fully defined (all design elements determined).

Customer is still determining the use case and the value this use case will bring if they  allow their expense users to request for a virtual card to pay for big ticket items like flight reservations and accommodations.
One or more Risks are incorporated into the current design

column2: <a href=""/en-us"" title=""What can we help you find?"">

column3: What can we help you find?

column1: SUBMITTED: 24 May 2023 | REVISED: 24 May 2023 | Submitted by Erna Uelderink

The Travel Service is a microservice that Coupa developed to manage integrations with 3rd party travel providers. It will help minimize the amount of work that Expense Users need to do to create Expense Reports. After a trip is booked, all the trip information is loaded into a Coupa expense report automatically, instead of the user having to spend extra time manually providing information into expense reports after making their travel arrangements.
• It is used for travel booking, including categories like lodging, airfare, car rentals and rail.

• The travel service integrates with Coupa and Expense users get expense reports pre-populated with data from the travel provider. The fields in that pre-populated expense report are editable, so users can make changes if needed.
• Specific users can be excluded from receiving automatic expense reports, just in case they already have corporate cards but still use your travel provider for planning their business trips.
For Egencia check here..
For Amadeus Cytric click here.
All services are also available via the Coupa app marketplace.
• First, you'll need to set up and schedule regular integrations between your travel provider and Coupa.

• Some travel providers (e.g. Egencia) don’t offer a test environment. When implementing the Travel service you can check if the integration works by creating a custom Expense Line view and adding a filter for the field External Source data containing “travel”.
• The logo of the travel provider is displayed on expense report lines.

• Coupa evaluates travel receipts and corporate card transactions to find matches. When matches are found, the two transactions are automatically merged together into one expense line, with both corporate card and blue suitcase icons appearing in the expense line.

• If a travel receipt is forwarded first: When a travel receipt is forwarded first, a new expense report is created and expense lines will be added for each booking. Once matching corporate card lines are imported, the travel receipt lines will be pulled-out of the trip report and automatically merged with their matching corporate card lines.

• If Corp Card lines arrive first: If travel receipts are forwarded after the corporate card feed, the travel receipts are automatically merged with their matching corporate card lines in the standard Corporate Card report. No new report lines will be created for that trip.
• Please note that for some Travel providers (e.g. Egencia) the customer has to sign an agreement with the Travel provider that they consent to share their data with Coupa
No specific country considerations other than different Travel providers might operate in an area.
Use Travel Integration for all users
Use Travel Integration for selected user (group)s.

By not setting up the Travel service while one of the mentioned Travel platforms is used to book travel in your organization will decrease end user’s satisfaction and might delay the timely submittal of expense reports.
Automate as much as possible the creation of Expense Reports will increase the timely submittal of expenses by end users
Travel Service will not be used for any scenarios
No Risks are incorporated into the current design and the design is fully defined (all design elements determined)
Customer is still determining use cases for Travel Service
One or more Risks are incorporated into the current design
Travel Service data is not integrated and end users create the expense reports manually
Related Success Metrics and Value Drivers
• Expenses within policy limit (Airfare savings opportunities)
• Travel Provider Integration and Reconciliation

column7: <input type=""hidden"" name=""PageName"" value=""Invoicing - Real-Time Alerts in Spend Guard"">

column2: <a href=""/en-us"" title=""What can we help you find?"">

column3: What can we help you find?

column1: Invoicing - Real-Time Alerts in Spend Guard

In Spend Guard, documents are flagged using 1 of 2 evaluation methods: Real-Time or Periodic.  Being able to detect suspicious spend activity in real-time (or near real-time) enables your company to take preventative action toward reducing fraudulent spend vs. after-the-fact detection when at-risk spend is no longer recoverable.

When invoices are submitted, Spend Guard uses the evaluation methods of both On-Submission and Periodic to raise specific alerts if it detects potential suspicious behavior.  If Spend Guard detects a potential for Duplicate Invoices being submitted, you have the ability to add an additional Approver to the existing approval chains.  Spend Guard uses both Spend Guard Evaluator and Spend Guard Auditor for these situations.

Since invoices can be approved almost immediately after submission there may be times where the Spend Guard evaluation process may not have fully completed.  The Spend Guard Evaluator is an automated, non-human approver added to an approval chain which allows up to one hour after invoice submission for the Spend Guard evaluation process to complete.  If the Spend Guard Evaluator raises an Alert there can then be an Approver automatically added called Spend Guard Auditor.  This is an individual within your organization who will now be required to approve the invoice prior to continuing to additional approvers.

Spend Guard will Alert on duplication of invoices regardless of if additional approvals are set up.  These can be reviewed by Spend Guard Auditors at a later date.  Customers need to decide whether an approval is needed as a preventative control or to use Spend Guard for after-the-fact detection & monitoring at go-live.
• Spend Guard will be introducing new insight into compliance monitoring across your organization so using the tool for after-the-fact reporting only may be most suitable.
• Preventative controls such as an additional approver can be added at a later date.
• Additional approval controls should be considered if your potential Spend At Risk value translates to large savings opportunities for your organization.
• Spend Guard approvals should be designed in-line with your existing approvals design.
• When configuring an approval for Duplicate Invoice Alerts, only future net-new transactions will be flagged and routed.  Previous alerts are not affected.
• Spend Guard will review the past 12 months of invoices after being turned on and may trigger additional alerts needing review.\
• Spend Guard Alerts require continuous review of Alerts to mark flagged items as compliant or non-compliant.
• Customers should evaluate their level of personnel and number of individuals who will have access to reviewing and resolving SG Alerts.
Enable Real-time Alerts for duplicate invoices.
Invoicing Alerts are reviewed by Spend Guard Auditor periodically and not in real-time.
Real-time Alerts are not used and non-compliant spend is paid.  Additional time and costs are associated with trying to recoup this spend.
Real-time, or Near real-time alerts, give Auditing teams the ability to track and take action on suspicious spend activity as it's generated.

When flagged in real-time, Spend Guard Alert banners specify why an alert was raised on a transaction.  With appropriate licensing and user roles, Current Approvers can utilize these alert banners to identify potential issues and guide their approval response accordingly.
Spend Guard Evaluator approval chain is set up with Spend Guard Auditor able to review and approve duplicate invoices in near real-time.
Spend Guard Evaluator approval is set up without Auditor approval step.
Not having SG Evaluator approval step set up could allow invoices to be paid before SG process has completed.
If SG Auditor roles are not part of approval process alerts will need to be reviewed at a later date.
In-flight controls enable organizations to adopt a more proactive approach towards Compliance Monitoring.
In-flight controls allow your business to stop potentially fraudulent spend from moving through approvals and/or being paid.
Real-Time Alert types and In-flight controls will not be used for any scenarios
No Risks are incorporated into the current design and the design is fully defined (all design elements determined)
Customer is still determining use cases / how Real-Time alerts and In-flight controls will be incorporated into their workflows
One or more Risks are incorporated into the current design
Compliance detection and maintenance are managed offline or via a third-party system
• First Time Match Rate by Invoice Amount/Count*
Warning

Introducing in-flight controls can have reverse impacts on growth measurements for these (*) KPIs.  For example, prior to In-flight controls, an Invoice may be counted toward the company's First Time Match Rate.  However, post In-flight controls, an Invoice may now get flagged for additional Compliance review before proceeding to 'Approved' status.  Meaning, if a customer implements additional Compliance review when Spend Guard detects Duplicate Invoices in real-time, Invoices that would otherwise be auto-approved, would then trigger approvals.
• Spend Guard Introduction Video
• Getting Started with Spend Guard
• Spend Guard Community Collaboration
• In-Flight Controls for Spend Guard and Approvals
• Spend Guard Evaluation in Approvals

column2: <a href=""/en-us"" title=""What can we help you find?"">

column3: What can we help you find?

column1: There are two ways to integrate with Coupa:

• Built-In Integration Dashboard capabilities include:
     - History of all import and export integration runs are available with a detailed breakdown of success vs failure
     - History of all the failures that ever occurred are also available

• Built-in error handling capabilities include:
     - Notifying business teams on functional errors and integration admins on technical errors is available by setting those users as Integration Contacts
     - Ability for users with specific permissions to view the CSV files to perform any reviews and can take necessary actions
• Integration routines with huge data sets/volumes should consider CSV approach
• Coupa can archive the imported CSV files on the SFTP for reprocessing them if needed
• Multiple CSV files can be processed in parallel at a time
• You need an easy audit trail of data moving between systems
• You want a clearly defined hand-off between internal and external systems
• Your IT team is more comfortable parsing data and doing data transformations with CSV flat files as opposed to using XML data and making REST API calls
• After a successful sftp file read/write, middleware should automatically close the sftp connection.

• Use the Coupa REST API when
    - You need to update data in Coupa real time
    - You have a need to orchestrate different service calls across multiple systems
    - You want sophisticated error handling
    - You need to make frequent API calls with small numbers of records (API should not be used for infrequent batch integrations for example)

• Do not use Coupa REST API when
    - Bulk import/exporting data
    - There is no business need to have real time data integration (e.g. nightly update of users from ERP to Coupa)
    - You do not have a middleware tool to simplify and monitor API-based integrations
• Customer can perform additional API calls to utilize Coupa Integration and error handling dashboard capabilities.
• We do not archive the API request payloads.
• Coupa API Postman Collections
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Integration Type"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">CSV</th>
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">File Naming Convention</th>

File Naming Convention: <IntegrationObject>_<DateTimeStamp>.csv

Example: Users_20220128_091003.csv

File Names with out dated time stamp

Example:
Users.csv
Having unique filenames will help to identify the file when troubleshooting issues.
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Integration Type"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">CSV</th>
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">File Extension</th>
Use lowercase .csv as file extension
using uppercase .CSV as file extension
Coupa doesn't support uppercase.CSV as file extension.
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Integration Type"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">CSV</th>
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">File Encryption</th>
Coupa supports PGP key encryption/decryption for both SFTP import and exports of CSV files
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Integration Type"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">CSV</th>
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">Special Characters</th>
New Line and carriage return characters should be handled properly. Double quotes should be escaped with additional double quotes. Recommended enclosing every field in double quotes.
Not handling special characters
Not handling special characters as part of the integration development will result in failures during the file upload.
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Integration Type"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">CSV</th>
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">File Size</th>
File size should not be exceeding 8 MB. Larger files should be split into multiple 8 MB files. Multiple records should be sent in single file.
Sending one file per record into Coupa or files greater than 8 MB.
Higher the volume, the longer it takes for the system to complete the import process and potentially impacting other functions of the system.
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Integration Type"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">CSV</th>
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">
Include only the fields that are needed for the integration from the headers. Integration Transactional Formats will be used for exports where we can add/remove columns from the CSV file headers.
Including all the fields in the header irrespective of the usage
Removing unwanted fields from the CSV file headers will help with the system performance and troubleshooting errors.
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Integration Type"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">CSV</th>
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">Parsing Data</th>
Using position of the field in the file
Using positions to read the data from a CSV file causes issues when the file format changes if an Integration Admin add/removes a field in the integration export formats.
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Integration Type"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">CSV</th>
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">Integration Contacts</th>
Setup integration contacts for all the integrations in scope to receive functional/technical error email notifications
Not setting integration contacts
By default, all Coupa Admins will receive integration related error notifications. To send emails to specific team members that handles the integrations, setting up integration contacts is the way.
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Integration Type"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">CSV</th>
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">SFTP Authentication</th>
Basic username and password
Coupa does support SFTP authentication using SSH keys and basic username/password.
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Integration Type"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">CSV</th>
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">SFTP Connection</th>
After a successful sftp file read/write, middleware should automatically close the sftp connection
Leaving the sftp connection active in idle state for longer periods of time
Leaving it idle can cause issues where other system won't be able to access the SFTP
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Integration Type"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">CSV</th>
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">Nullify a field value</th>
Pass in --NULL-- in the column that need to be updated as blank
Passing blank space in the CSV file column
Passing blank space in the CSV file column won't update the existing column value
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Integration Type"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">CSV/API</th>
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">Data Dependency</th>

Orchestrate dependencies by properly spacing inbound files to Coupa

Example: Suppliers should be pre-loaded before uploading Remit-To Addresses into Coupa.
Not considering the data dependencies
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Integration Type"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">API</th>
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">Payload</th>
Choose only the required and used fields for POST/PUT operation. Only one record can be loaded at a time through POST/PUT API action
Including unwanted fields in payload will increase the processing time it takes for each record.
API will be much more responsive when the payloads are only including fields that are needed.
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Integration Type"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">API</th>
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">Schema Validation</th>
Build the payloads using XML/JSON examples or with no strict schema validations
Building integrations with strict API validations
Do not recommend strict XSD validations. This way integration doesn't result in failures when XSD schema changes over multiple Coupa releases.
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Integration Type"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">API</th>
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">API Response Filters</th>
Fields query param
API Response Filters
Not using API filters or fields query parameter
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Integration Type"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">API</th>
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">Parallel Threads</th>
Not to exceed more than 8 parallel threads for all API calls at a given single point in time
No parallel execution and only one API call at a given point in time
More than 8 parallel threads.
Performing API calls using parallel threads will help in processing records faster. Using more than 8 parallel threads will start impacting other functions performed by users in the system.
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Integration Type"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">API</th>
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">Special Characters</th>
Using CDATA for XML payloads
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Integration Type"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">API</th>
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">Authentication</th>
API keys feature is being deprecated and is not available for new customers.
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Integration Type"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">API</th>
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">Payload Format</th>
Coupa REST APIs support both XML and JSON formats
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Integration Type"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">API</th>
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align: middle;"">Error handling</th>
Use Integration Runs API to record the success vs errors and to validate the total number of records that are processed.
Particular integration type is not used
No Risks are incorporated into the current design and follows the recommended design
Customer is still determining use cases for integration types
One or more Risks are incorporated into the current design
Use of middleware and any other external services to design/develop integrations.
Integration Best Practices
Coupa Postman Collection

column2: <a href=""/en-us"" title=""What can we help you find?"">

column3: What can we help you find?

column1: To have access to Coupa system and perform activities related to procurement, invoicing, receiving and many others.
• Chart of Accounts, Departments, Content Groups, Approval Groups, Roles, should pre-exist in Coupa
• LDAP - ""ldap""  - The Login field is mapped to the LDAP sAMAccountName field
• SAML - ""saml"" - The Sso Identifier field is mapped to the SAML NameID
• Coupa Credentials - Standard Coupa out of the box login option.
• Unique keys priority is Id, login, employee-number
• We cannot update Employee Number using Login. Coupa tries to create a new record with the login, and the integration will fail.
• You can update Login using Employee Number. However, you cannot update Employee Number using Login. Coupa tries to create a new record with the login, and the integration will fail.
• For using management hierarchy positions as approval limits, provide the position names directly in the approval limit fields and system will assign the amounts accordingly.

• The Users Import process read files from ./Incoming/Users in the SFTP. These files will be moved to the archive folder located at ./Archive/Incoming/Users before being processed in alphanumeric order
• API supports creation and update of users
• Users ID is must to perform updates through API PUT calls
• With user id, we can update any other columns like login, email, name, roles, content-groups etc

Before developing the integration, we strongly recommend reading through the details for each integration type available here. Initial load of users must be loaded into Coupa using the CSV bulk upload option
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align:middle;"">User Agent</th>
Supported Web browsers are Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Microsoft Edge. Coupa will end support for Internet Explorer beginning with the May ‘22 Release (R33)
Middleware has capability to identify the updated records in HR/Other system using the last update date_time_stamp
Customer stores a copy of previously sent file on their side and uses it to compare with latest file and sends only deltas to Coupa.
- Coupa exports all users data daily once/multiple times to middleware and customer's integration will compare it with ERP and sends deltas.
- No delta integration. Full load of users data sent to Coupa every day with the updates included in it.

Exporting master data full loads every day can result in performance issues because of volumes being high. Also loading full load of users every day for updates also takes long times to complete processing of all the records which can lead to performance issues.
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align:middle;"">Roles/Content groups assignment - CSV</th>
Updated roles/content-groups are included in the CSV file and Coupa upsert logic will automatically perform the  updates
Roles and Contentgroups should pre-exist in Coupa before loading the files for processing.
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align:middle;"">Roles/Content groups assignment - API </th>
Remove all the existing roles & content groups in the first API PUT call followed by another API call  to add them back with the updated roles & content groups
Use Content-Type in the API call headers, if there are special characters in the names of content groups or roles
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align:middle;"">License Counts</th>
Integration works for only approved user license counts and has a logic to confirm the active user count in Coupa before loading new users.
Customer will be loading additional users as inactive into Coupa.
Approved user license counts will help customer to be aware of how many licenses are assigned to users vs available
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align:middle;"">Data Dependency</th>
Managers should be loaded into Coupa prior to referencing those user records as approver logins in other user records
Loading all the users at a time with out proper differentiation
Integration should take data dependencies into consideration to avoid failures related to it
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align:middle;"">Data Readiness</th>
• Approval Limits (If using Management Positions to define approval limits)
Not planning on proper master data existence in Coupa.
User Integration will not be in scope
No Risks are incorporated into the current design and the design is fully defined (all design elements determined).
Customer is still determining use cases for user integration
One or more Risks are incorporated into the current design
While no specific success metrics are related to users, this integration will provide value by making sure the users are created/updated and are able to access the system with no issues.

column2: <a href=""/en-us"" title=""What can we help you find?"">

column3: What can we help you find?

column1: Common use cases for customers to bring external invoices into Coupa:
• When an OCR solution like Kofax,CTI etc are in scope to read/transform supplier submitted invoice pdfs
• Invoices from any external systems where spend is recorded are brought into Coupa for reporting/analytics capabilities
• Suppliers who have high volumes and refuse to use CSP or cXML
• Prior to integrating invoices into Coupa from external systems make sure that the External systems have access to Coupa Master data such as Items, Suppliers, Commodities, Accounts via integrations

• Recommendation is to not make changes to Invoices in either system once it is submitted. If significant changes are needed, Coupa recommends that any updates are made directly in Coupa, not in the external system
• For billing account segments, recommend passing both account code and individual segments in the CSV file or API payload.
• Uniquely identifying an invoice requires the Invoice Number and one of Supplier Name or Supplier Number.
• Don't exceed five active connections at a time when importing via sFTP
• The loader looks up supplier based first on number, then based on name.
• Submit for approval column should be marked as ""Yes""
• Requster Email or Requester Name must be included
• Coupa does not allow updates to invoices through CSV loaders
• Attachments are allowed during invoice creation and should be zipped as per Coupa instructions

• Invoice Import integration processes the files from ./Incoming/Invoices folder via SFTP. These files will be moved to the archive folder located at ./Archive/Incoming/Invoices before being processed in alphanumeric order
• Do not load more than 100 invoices per file, as it will take longer to load and debug during failures
• Do not load 1 invoice per CSV file. Always batch multiple invoices into a single file for better processing
• CSV UTF-8 encoded file format with only required headers & fields to be specified in the CSV file
• Invoices API supports both creation and updates of invoice records
• Only 1 invoice per 1 API POST/PUT call is supported
• After creating invoice using API, additional PUT call is required to submit the invoice
• Requester ID or email or login must be included
• Attachments will have to be added by performing an additional API call after invoice is created in Coupa using Attachments API
• To pass remit-to-address through API, recommend using Remit-To Code and for Ship-To address, use location-code
• For Shipping/Handling/Misc charges, pass them in their specific section of the payload i.e. invoice-charges
• For Payment Term, Unit of Measure, Currency recommend using the code values in the payload

- For Compliance CFDI Invoice uploads, the XML file should be placed in /Incoming/Cfdi folder of the SFTP. If the folder is not available by default, please reach out to the Coupa representative assigned to the project

- For Buyer CFDI Invoice uploads, the XML file should be placed in /Incoming/CfdiBuyerInvoice folder of the SFTP. If the folder is not available by default, please reach out to the Coupa representative assigned to the project
- If using the SFTP CSV flat file Import, multiple tax lines should be tested properly using the Tax line header.
- Legal Payment Receipt Loader supports only XML format and not CSV. To upload an XML into Coupa from SFTP, XML file should be placed into /Incoming/CfdiBuyerInvoice
- If using the sFTP CSV flat file Import, multiple tax lines should be tested properly using the Tax line header.
Before developing the integration, we strongly recommend reading through the details for each integration type available here.
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align:middle;"">Invoice Updates</th>
Minimize changes on Invoices once sent for Approvals
If needed, minimal changes to be done made directly in Coupa UI.
Significant changes to Invoices after submitted for approval
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align:middle;"">PO backed invoices</th>
Coupa can export all the POs to the external system along with other master data like suppliers, addresses to load invoices against an existing PO.
External system loads all the invoices as unbacked with a custom field providing the Coupa PO reference details for AP to manually select in Coupa.
PO backed invoices doesn't need manual touches in most of the cases given all the billing account segments and other details are already available and the process will be easy to handle.
When an invoice is uploaded into Coupa, pass in the PO number and PO line number references in it and Coupa will automatically assign the billing segments from the PO line to invoice line
Passing in valid account code combinations for invoice lines in the CSV file
Passing in dummy segment values in the invoice upload and routing it through approval chains for AP team to update them manually in Coupa
Allowing users to enter accounting details will increase the manual tasks that needs to be performed by AP team
CSV file and actual attachments should be zipped together
Adding attachments on an existing invoice using Invoices API
Zipping the folder that contains CSV file and attachments
Zipping the folder that contains actual files will results in failures during processing. More details on attachments can be found here.
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align:middle;"">Invoice Line Volumes</th>
100 lines per Invoice
Between 100 and 500 lines (including line splits) per Invoice and have to enable ""Next Gen Invoicing UI""
Exceeding more than 500 lines (including line splits) per invoice
Line limits apply within the UI or CSV loader or the API. Coupa supports up to 100 lines per invoice by default.
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align:middle;"">Split Billing</th>
Each split billing allocation to be loaded as separate invoice lines in an invoice
Having multiple invoice line allocations against multiple invoice lines in an invoice below the count of 500 lines(including splits).
Having multiple invoice line allocations against multiple invoice lines in an invoice exceeding count of 500 lines(including splits).
Most ERPs don't support split billing and prefer the lines with split billing to be loaded as separate invoice lines into Coupa and once approved into the ERP as Ok2Pay
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align:middle;"">Invoice Volumes</th>
100 invoices per file
Loading high volumes of invoices per file using CSV import
Loading high volumes of invoices per file using CSV import would make the troubleshooting complex if there is a failure.
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align:middle;"">Next Gen Invoicing UI</th>
It improves the experience of editing and submitting invoices through UI, when an invoice has more than 100 invoice lines (including line splits) in it
Having to update an invoice through UI, when an invoice has more than 500 invoice lines (including line splits) in it
Do not recommend using the buyer sFTP bulk loader for countries where compliance is a crucial part of invoicing
Use Supplier specific sFTP channel to load invoices where it considered as compliance invoice.
Invoices uploaded through buyer sFTP bulk loader will follow the Buyer-Validated Compliant Invoicing process. Coupa doesn't generate legal tax invoice PDF with digital signature
Countries like Mexico, United Kingdom etc where compliance matters, recommend using invoice channels CSP, SAN, cXML to submit invoices
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align:middle;"">Dynamic approval chains</th>
Instruct to create single invoice per cost center/department billing segment to minimize number of approvers
Loading an invoice with multiple cost centers/departments and causing it to add additional approvers to the approval chain

Having cost center/department based approvals could have a list of multiple sequential approvers as cost center owners on invoices allocated to multiple cost centers or departments which will impact invoice approval cycle times
Don't use auto dispute on buyer sFTP loaded invoices and route through approval chains as needed
Route all buyer sFTP loaded invoices to requester/AP team for review
Auto disputing buyer uploaded invoices will lead to confusions on supplier side
Given these are manually buyer-entered/loaded invoices, review and correction process should be handled by the buyer organization and not by the supplier
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align:middle;"">Legacy/non-Coupa spend Invoices</th>
Do not recommend bringing in legacy open or non-coupa spend invoices into Coupa
using Coupa AIC Module
Bringing legacy open and non-Coupa spend invoices into Coupa
Bringing in legacy invoices into Coupa will impact the success metrics and also the referencial data might not exist.
<th class=""mt-column-width-15"" data-th=""Design Element"" scope=""row"" style=""vertical-align:middle;"">Data Readiness</th>
Referential data should pre-exist in Coupa like
Users manually selecting the master data elements in Coupa will hinder the user experience, if there are 100s of invoices loaded into Coupa.
Submitting the invoices for approvals by the time of file processing will reduce the manual actions and the approval times will be faster with a better user experience.
External Invoice Integration will not be used for any scenarios
No Risks are incorporated into the current design and the design is fully defined (all design elements determined).
Customer is still determining use cases for external invoices
One or more Risks are incorporated into the current design
Invoices API Examples
